speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: SCENE II. Before the cave of Belarius.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Enter, from the cave, BELARIUS, GUIDERIUS, ARVIRAGUS, and IMOGEN

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: [To IMOGEN]  You are not well: remain here in the cave;

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: We'll come to you after hunting.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: [To IMOGEN] Brother, stay here

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Are we not brothers?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: So man and man should be;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: But clay and clay differs in dignity,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Whose dust is both alike. I am very sick.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Go you to hunting; I'll abide with him.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: So sick I am not, yet I am not well;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: But not so citizen a wanton as

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To seem to die ere sick: so please you, leave me;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Stick to your journal course: the breach of custom

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Is breach of all. I am ill, but your being by me

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Cannot amend me; society is no comfort

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To one not sociable: I am not very sick,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Since I can reason of it. Pray you, trust me here:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I'll rob none but myself; and let me die,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Stealing so poorly.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: I love thee; I have spoke it

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: How much the quantity, the weight as much,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: As I do love my father.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: What! how! how!

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: If it be sin to say so, I yoke me

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: In my good brother's fault: I know not why

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: I love this youth; and I have heard you say,

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Love's reason's without reason: the bier at door,

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: And a demand who is't shall die, I'd say

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: 'My father, not this youth.'

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: [Aside] O noble strain!

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: O worthiness of nature! breed of greatness!

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Cowards father cowards and base things sire base:

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Nature hath meal and bran, contempt and grace.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: I'm not their father; yet who this should be,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Doth miracle itself, loved before me.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: 'Tis the ninth hour o' the morn.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Brother, farewell.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I wish ye sport.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: You health. So please you, sir.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: [Aside]  These are kind creatures. Gods, what lies

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I have heard!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Our courtiers say all's savage but at court:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Experience, O, thou disprovest report!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: The imperious seas breed monsters, for the dish

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Poor tributary rivers as sweet fish.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I am sick still; heart-sick. Pisanio,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I'll now taste of thy drug.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Swallows some

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: I could not stir him:

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: He said he was gentle, but unfortunate;

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Dishonestly afflicted, but yet honest.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Thus did he answer me: yet said, hereafter

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: I might know more.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: To the field, to the field!

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: We'll leave you for this time: go in and rest.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: We'll not be long away.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Pray, be not sick,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: For you must be our housewife.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Well or ill,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I am bound to you.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: And shalt be ever.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Exit IMOGEN, to the cave

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: This youth, how'er distress'd, appears he hath had

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Good ancestors.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: How angel-like he sings!

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: But his neat cookery! he cut our roots

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: In characters,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: And sauced our broths, as Juno had been sick

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: And he her dieter.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Nobly he yokes

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: A smiling with a sigh, as if the sigh

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Was that it was, for not being such a smile;

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: The smile mocking the sigh, that it would fly

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: From so divine a temple, to commix

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: With winds that sailors rail at.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: I do note

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: That grief and patience, rooted in him both,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Mingle their spurs together.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Grow, patience!

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: And let the stinking elder, grief, untwine

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: His perishing root with the increasing vine!

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: It is great morning. Come, away!--

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Who's there?

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Enter CLOTEN

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: I cannot find those runagates; that villain

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Hath mock'd me. I am faint.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: 'Those runagates!'

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Means he not us? I partly know him: 'tis

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Cloten, the son o' the queen. I fear some ambush.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: I saw him not these many years, and yet

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: I know 'tis he. We are held as outlaws: hence!

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: He is but one: you and my brother search

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: What companies are near: pray you, away;

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Let me alone with him.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Exeunt BELARIUS and ARVIRAGUS

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Soft! What are you

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: That fly me thus? some villain mountaineers?

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: I have heard of such. What slave art thou?

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: A thing

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: More slavish did I ne'er than answering

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: A slave without a knock.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Thou art a robber,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: A law-breaker, a villain: yield thee, thief.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: To who? to thee? What art thou? Have not I

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: An arm as big as thine? a heart as big?

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Thy words, I grant, are bigger, for I wear not

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: My dagger in my mouth. Say what thou art,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Why I should yield to thee?

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Thou villain base,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Know'st me not by my clothes?

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: No, nor thy tailor, rascal,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Who is thy grandfather: he made those clothes,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Which, as it seems, make thee.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Thou precious varlet,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: My tailor made them not.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Hence, then, and thank

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: The man that gave them thee. Thou art some fool;

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: I am loath to beat thee.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Thou injurious thief,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Hear but my name, and tremble.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: What's thy name?

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Cloten, thou villain.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Cloten, thou double villain, be thy name,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: I cannot tremble at it: were it Toad, or

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Adder, Spider,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: 'Twould move me sooner.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: To thy further fear,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Nay, to thy mere confusion, thou shalt know

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: I am son to the queen.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: I am sorry for 't; not seeming

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: So worthy as thy birth.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Art not afeard?

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Those that I reverence those I fear, the wise:

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: At fools I laugh, not fear them.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Die the death:

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: When I have slain thee with my proper hand,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: I'll follow those that even now fled hence,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: And on the gates of Lud's-town set your heads:

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Yield, rustic mountaineer.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Exeunt, fighting

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Re-enter BELARIUS and ARVIRAGUS

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: No companies abroad?

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: None in the world: you did mistake him, sure.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: I cannot tell: long is it since I saw him,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: But time hath nothing blurr'd those lines of favour

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Which then he wore; the snatches in his voice,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: And burst of speaking, were as his: I am absolute

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: 'Twas very Cloten.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: In this place we left them:

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: I wish my brother make good time with him,

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: You say he is so fell.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Being scarce made up,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: I mean, to man, he had not apprehension

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Of roaring terrors; for the effect of judgment

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Is oft the cause of fear. But, see, thy brother.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Re-enter GUIDERIUS, with CLOTEN'S head

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: This Cloten was a fool, an empty purse;

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: There was no money in't: not Hercules

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Could have knock'd out his brains, for he had none:

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Yet I not doing this, the fool had borne

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: My head as I do his.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: What hast thou done?

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: I am perfect what: cut off one Cloten's head,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Son to the queen, after his own report;

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Who call'd me traitor, mountaineer, and swore

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: With his own single hand he'ld take us in

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Displace our heads where--thank the gods!--they grow,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: And set them on Lud's-town.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: We are all undone.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Why, worthy father, what have we to lose,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: But that he swore to take, our lives? The law

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Protects not us: then why should we be tender

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: To let an arrogant piece of flesh threat us,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Play judge and executioner all himself,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: For we do fear the law? What company

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Discover you abroad?

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: No single soul

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Can we set eye on; but in all safe reason

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: He must have some attendants. Though his humour

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Was nothing but mutation, ay, and that

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: From one bad thing to worse; not frenzy, not

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Absolute madness could so far have raved

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: To bring him here alone; although perhaps

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: It may be heard at court that such as we

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Cave here, hunt here, are outlaws, and in time

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: May make some stronger head; the which he hearing--

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: As it is like him--might break out, and swear

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: He'ld fetch us in; yet is't not probable

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: To come alone, either he so undertaking,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Or they so suffering: then on good ground we fear,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: If we do fear this body hath a tail

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: More perilous than the head.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Let ordinance

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Come as the gods foresay it: howsoe'er,

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: My brother hath done well.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: I had no mind

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: To hunt this day: the boy Fidele's sickness

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Did make my way long forth.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: With his own sword,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Which he did wave against my throat, I have ta'en

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: His head from him: I'll throw't into the creek

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Behind our rock; and let it to the sea,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: And tell the fishes he's the queen's son, Cloten:

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: That's all I reck.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: I fear 'twill be revenged:

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Would, Polydote, thou hadst not done't! though valour

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Becomes thee well enough.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Would I had done't

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: So the revenge alone pursued me! Polydore,

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: I love thee brotherly, but envy much

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Thou hast robb'd me of this deed: I would revenges,

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: That possible strength might meet, would seek us through

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: And put us to our answer.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Well, 'tis done:

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: We'll hunt no more to-day, nor seek for danger

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Where there's no profit. I prithee, to our rock;

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: You and Fidele play the cooks: I'll stay

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Till hasty Polydote return, and bring him

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: To dinner presently.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Poor sick Fidele!

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: I'll weringly to him: to gain his colour

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: I'ld let a parish of such Clotens' blood,

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: And praise myself for charity.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: O thou goddess,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Thou divine Nature, how thyself thou blazon'st

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: In these two princely boys! They are as gentle

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: As zephyrs blowing below the violet,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Not wagging his sweet head; and yet as rough,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Their royal blood enchafed, as the rudest wind,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: That by the top doth take the mountain pine,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: And make him stoop to the vale. 'Tis wonder

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: That an invisible instinct should frame them

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: To royalty unlearn'd, honour untaught,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Civility not seen from other, valour

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: That wildly grows in them, but yields a crop

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: As if it had been sow'd. Yet still it's strange

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: What Cloten's being here to us portends,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Or what his death will bring us.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Re-enter GUIDERIUS

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Where's my brother?

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: I have sent Cloten's clotpoll down the stream,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: In embassy to his mother: his body's hostage

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: For his return.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Solemn music

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: My ingenious instrument!

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Hark, Polydore, it sounds! But what occasion

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Hath Cadwal now to give it motion? Hark!

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Is he at home?

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: He went hence even now.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: What does he mean? since death of my dear'st mother

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: it did not speak before. All solemn things

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Should answer solemn accidents. The matter?

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Triumphs for nothing and lamenting toys

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Is jollity for apes and grief for boys.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Is Cadwal mad?

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Look, here he comes,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: And brings the dire occasion in his arms

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Of what we blame him for.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Re-enter ARVIRAGUS, with IMOGEN, as dead, bearing her in his arms

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: The bird is dead

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: That we have made so much on. I had rather

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Have skipp'd from sixteen years of age to sixty,

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: To have turn'd my leaping-time into a crutch,

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Than have seen this.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: O sweetest, fairest lily!

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: My brother wears thee not the one half so well

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: As when thou grew'st thyself.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: O melancholy!

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Who ever yet could sound thy bottom? find

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: The ooze, to show what coast thy sluggish crare

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Might easiliest harbour in? Thou blessed thing!

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Jove knows what man thou mightst have made; but I,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Thou diedst, a most rare boy, of melancholy.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: How found you him?

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Stark, as you see:

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Thus smiling, as some fly hid tickled slumber,

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Not as death's dart, being laugh'd at; his

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: right cheek

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Reposing on a cushion.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Where?

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: O' the floor;

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: His arms thus leagued: I thought he slept, and put

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: My clouted brogues from off my feet, whose rudeness

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Answer'd my steps too loud.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Why, he but sleeps:

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: If he be gone, he'll make his grave a bed;

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: With female fairies will his tomb be haunted,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: And worms will not come to thee.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: With fairest flowers

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Whilst summer lasts and I live here, Fidele,

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: I'll sweeten thy sad grave: thou shalt not lack

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: The flower that's like thy face, pale primrose, nor

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: The azured harebell, like thy veins, no, nor

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: The leaf of eglantine, whom not to slander,

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Out-sweeten'd not thy breath: the ruddock would,

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: With charitable bill,--O bill, sore-shaming

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Those rich-left heirs that let their fathers lie

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Without a monument!--bring thee all this;

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Yea, and furr'd moss besides, when flowers are none,

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: To winter-ground thy corse.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Prithee, have done;

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: And do not play in wench-like words with that

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Which is so serious. Let us bury him,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: And not protract with admiration what

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Is now due debt. To the grave!

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Say, where shall's lay him?

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: By good Euriphile, our mother.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Be't so:

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: And let us, Polydore, though now our voices

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Have got the mannish crack, sing him to the ground,

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: As once our mother; use like note and words,

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Save that Euriphile must be Fidele.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Cadwal,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: I cannot sing: I'll weep, and word it with thee;

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: For notes of sorrow out of tune are worse

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Than priests and fanes that lie.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: We'll speak it, then.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Great griefs, I see, medicine the less; for Cloten

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Is quite forgot. He was a queen's son, boys;

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: And though he came our enemy, remember

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: He was paid for that: though mean and

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: mighty, rotting

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Together, have one dust, yet reverence,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: That angel of the world, doth make distinction

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Of place 'tween high and low. Our foe was princely

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: And though you took his life, as being our foe,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Yet bury him as a prince.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Pray You, fetch him hither.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Thersites' body is as good as Ajax',

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: When neither are alive.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: If you'll go fetch him,

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: We'll say our song the whilst. Brother, begin.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Exit BELARIUS

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Nay, Cadwal, we must lay his head to the east;

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: My father hath a reason for't.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: 'Tis true.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Come on then, and remove him.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: So. Begin.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: SONG

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Fear no more the heat o' the sun,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Nor the furious winter's rages;

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Thou thy worldly task hast done,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Home art gone, and ta'en thy wages:

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Golden lads and girls all must,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: As chimney-sweepers, come to dust.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Fear no more the frown o' the great;

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Thou art past the tyrant's stroke;

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Care no more to clothe and eat;

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: To thee the reed is as the oak:

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: The sceptre, learning, physic, must

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: All follow this, and come to dust.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Fear no more the lightning flash,

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Nor the all-dreaded thunder-stone;

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Fear not slander, censure rash;

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Thou hast finish'd joy and moan:

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: All lovers young, all lovers must

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Consign to thee, and come to dust.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: No exorciser harm thee!

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Nor no witchcraft charm thee!

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Ghost unlaid forbear thee!

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Nothing ill come near thee!

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Quiet consummation have;

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: And renowned be thy grave!

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Re-enter BELARIUS, with the body of CLOTEN

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: We have done our obsequies: come, lay him down.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Here's a few flowers; but 'bout midnight, more:

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: The herbs that have on them cold dew o' the night

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Are strewings fitt'st for graves. Upon their faces.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: You were as flowers, now wither'd: even so

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: These herblets shall, which we upon you strew.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Come on, away: apart upon our knees.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: The ground that gave them first has them again:

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Their pleasures here are past, so is their pain.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Exeunt BELARIUS, GUIDERIUS, and ARVIRAGUS

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: [Awaking]  Yes, sir, to Milford-Haven; which is

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: the way?--

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I thank you.--By yond bush?--Pray, how far thither?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: 'Ods pittikins! can it be six mile yet?--

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I have gone all night. 'Faith, I'll lie down and sleep.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: But, soft! no bedfellow!--O god s and goddesses!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Seeing the body of CLOTEN

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: These flowers are like the pleasures of the world;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: This bloody man, the care on't. I hope I dream;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: For so I thought I was a cave-keeper,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: And cook to honest creatures: but 'tis not so;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: 'Twas but a bolt of nothing, shot at nothing,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Which the brain makes of fumes: our very eyes

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Are sometimes like our judgments, blind. Good faith,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I tremble stiff with fear: but if there be

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Yet left in heaven as small a drop of pity

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: As a wren's eye, fear'd gods, a part of it!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: The dream's here still: even when I wake, it is

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Without me, as within me; not imagined, felt.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: A headless man! The garments of Posthumus!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I know the shape of's leg: this is his hand;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: His foot Mercurial; his Martial thigh;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: The brawns of Hercules: but his Jovial face

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Murder in heaven?--How!--'Tis gone. Pisanio,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: All curses madded Hecuba gave the Greeks,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: And mine to boot, be darted on thee! Thou,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Conspired with that irregulous devil, Cloten,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Hast here cut off my lord. To write and read

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Be henceforth treacherous! Damn'd Pisanio

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Hath with his forged letters,--damn'd Pisanio--

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: From this most bravest vessel of the world

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Struck the main-top! O Posthumus! alas,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Where is thy head? where's that? Ay me!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: where's that?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Pisanio might have kill'd thee at the heart,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: And left this head on. How should this be? Pisanio?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: 'Tis he and Cloten: malice and lucre in them

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Have laid this woe here. O, 'tis pregnant, pregnant!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: The drug he gave me, which he said was precious

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: And cordial to me, have I not found it

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Murderous to the senses? That confirms it home:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: This is Pisanio's deed, and Cloten's: O!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Give colour to my pale cheek with thy blood,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: That we the horrider may seem to those

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Which chance to find us: O, my lord, my lord!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Falls on the body

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Enter LUCIUS, a Captain and other Officers, and a Soothsayer

speaker: Captain
text_entry: To them the legions garrison'd in Gailia,

speaker: Captain
text_entry: After your will, have cross'd the sea, attending

speaker: Captain
text_entry: You here at Milford-Haven with your ships:

speaker: Captain
text_entry: They are in readiness.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: But what from Rome?

speaker: Captain
text_entry: The senate hath stirr'd up the confiners

speaker: Captain
text_entry: And gentlemen of Italy, most willing spirits,

speaker: Captain
text_entry: That promise noble service: and they come

speaker: Captain
text_entry: Under the conduct of bold Iachimo,

speaker: Captain
text_entry: Syenna's brother.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: When expect you them?

speaker: Captain
text_entry: With the next benefit o' the wind.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: This forwardness

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Makes our hopes fair. Command our present numbers

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Be muster'd; bid the captains look to't. Now, sir,

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: What have you dream'd of late of this war's purpose?

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Last night the very gods show'd me a vision--

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: I fast and pray'd for their intelligence--thus:

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: I saw Jove's bird, the Roman eagle, wing'd

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: From the spongy south to this part of the west,

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: There vanish'd in the sunbeams: which portends--

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Unless my sins abuse my divination--

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Success to the Roman host.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Dream often so,

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: And never false. Soft, ho! what trunk is here

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Without his top? The ruin speaks that sometime

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: It was a worthy building. How! a page!

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Or dead, or sleeping on him? But dead rather;

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: For nature doth abhor to make his bed

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: With the defunct, or sleep upon the dead.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Let's see the boy's face.

speaker: Captain
text_entry: He's alive, my lord.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: He'll then instruct us of this body. Young one,

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Inform us of thy fortunes, for it seems

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: They crave to be demanded. Who is this

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Thou makest thy bloody pillow? Or who was he

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: That, otherwise than noble nature did,

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Hath alter'd that good picture? What's thy interest

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: In this sad wreck? How came it? Who is it?

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: What art thou?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I am nothing: or if not,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Nothing to be were better. This was my master,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: A very valiant Briton and a good,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: That here by mountaineers lies slain. Alas!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: There is no more such masters: I may wander

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: From east to occident, cry out for service,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Try many, all good, serve truly, never

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Find such another master.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: 'Lack, good youth!

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Thou movest no less with thy complaining than

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Thy master in bleeding: say his name, good friend.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Richard du Champ.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Aside

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: If I do lie and do

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: No harm by it, though the gods hear, I hope

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: They'll pardon it.--Say you, sir?

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Thy name?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Fidele, sir.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Thou dost approve thyself the very same:

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Thy name well fits thy faith, thy faith thy name.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Wilt take thy chance with me? I will not say

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Thou shalt be so well master'd, but, be sure,

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: No less beloved. The Roman emperor's letters,

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Sent by a consul to me, should not sooner

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Than thine own worth prefer thee: go with me.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I'll follow, sir. But first, an't please the gods,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I'll hide my master from the flies, as deep

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: As these poor pickaxes can dig; and when

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: With wild wood-leaves and weeds I ha' strew'd his grave,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: And on it said a century of prayers,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Such as I can, twice o'er, I'll weep and sigh;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: And leaving so his service, follow you,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: So please you entertain me.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Ay, good youth!

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: And rather father thee than master thee.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: My friends,

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: The boy hath taught us manly duties: let us

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Find out the prettiest daisied plot we can,

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: And make him with our pikes and partisans

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: A grave: come, arm him. Boy, he is preferr'd

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: By thee to us, and he shall be interr'd

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: As soldiers can. Be cheerful; wipe thine eyes

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Some falls are means the happier to arise.

speaker: CAIUS LUCIUS
text_entry: Exeunt
